Reviews.Title: For the price and capability, why not go Force?
Reviews.Author: A. Ghilardi
Reviews.Content: I have been using Boost mobile for over a year now and I wanted to get a new 4G capable phone. Went to Target, Best Buy and other places to find the HTC but they were out. At Target, there was one ZTE Force left and the saleswoman tried to steer me away from this phone. After her getting on her own phone and checking out details about this phone, she quickly realized this phone was bang for your buck. If you don't want to spend a ton of money on a phone and on a plan, this phone is actually quite nice. The saleslady also told me that I will need a larger SD card than I already had. I am currently using my old one and it is still working perfectly. I have downloaded tons of apps and games and still lots of space. The camera takes great photos outside but inside - not the best. Overall, this is much faster and better than a 3G-only phone and I am satisfied with it. So far, no real glitches (when there is an incoming email and I am already doing something on the browser, sometimes the screen will freeze but I just have to go back Home and reopen the app)and no real complaints. The battery lasts a long time - no need to charge again in the day. If you want to get a 4G phone but don't want to shell out the money for a larger brand, this one will definitely do.

Reviews.Title: Great 4G Phone So Far
Reviews.Author: A. Verchimak
Reviews.Content: My Samsung Galaxy Prevail had been acting up recently. Decided to look at my options. Figured If I'm upgrading, I'd try to get a 4g phone. This phone was very good price on Amazon, plus I had some Amazon credit, so an even better deal.I'll just say WOW!. Moving from an Android 2.3 phone to this is a night and day difference. Nice screen, decent cameras for a phone. Still learning some of the features of this phone. Very loud volume, easy to hear, even on speakerphone. Can have multiple browser windows open and doesn't bog down. Really nice when I am in a 4G area. So far, GREAT! Very good battery life.I was already a Boost customer, and due to on time payment s for 18 months, had my payment down to $35 a month for unlimited everything, from the starting point of $50 a month. I asked before switching what would happen to my rate, since the unlimited plans now start at $55. They said I would not restart at the $55, I was only moved to the $40 level, the lowest under their new set up.My only complaint so far, I wish the charging jack was on the bottom of the phone and not the side. Will update if things change.

Reviews.Title: Both Pro and Con
Reviews.Author: ROGER A HURVITZ
Reviews.Content: As one of the earlier buyers there are a few glitches.PROS: 1. Good Battery Life if one disables what one won't use and downloads easy task killer from the Android Market.  2. Good resolution and sound  3. Boost mobile only charges me $40.00 a month for 100% data, phone, and full internet @ LTE 4G Speeds  4. Reasonable price of $200.00 for the phoneCONS: 1. Sometimes when I shut off phone and re-start it freezes AND I have to remove the silicone protection cover I put on and the flimsy back to remove the battery for a minute and re-install battery, back, and silicone cover and then I can restart the phone--bothersome.  2.Sometimes lose signal for a short while while on Internet or an application on-line.

Reviews.Title: great phone, great price
Reviews.Author: Michelle
Reviews.Content: Super fast shipping coming from Amazon. The phone looks amazing and I love the android operating system. I rely heavily on my phone and it's battery life is doing pretty well. This phone is also known as the Sprint Force or the Boost Force on their carrier websites. After shopping around, the best price for this phone brand new is from amazon.

Reviews.Title: So far, so good.
Reviews.Author: Jamie Knoll
Reviews.Content: Came from LG Android phone - this is much faster - love that.  BIgger screen, love that too.  Time will tell.

Reviews.Title: Cheapest Android 4G phone
Reviews.Author: Marc Yu "Real Meal"
Reviews.Content: It's the cheapest Android 4G phone I have phone that is of high quality.  Fast dual processor makes this phone a dream.  I use WiFi Tether to make it a hot spot for my laptop and iPad.  I used the WiFi Tether for Root Users (very easy to root) at code.google.com/p/android-wifi-tether.

Reviews.Title: A very satisfying purchase
Reviews.Author: angel calderon
Reviews.Content: A huge upgrade form my old Galaxy Prevail a big improvement big leg up for ZTE this phone is fast and efficient

Reviews.Title: BAD phone. Worst EVER
Reviews.Author: Kristen Dorsey
Reviews.Content: This has been the worst phone I have ever had for the basic things- such as SIGNAL STRENGTH and such. This phone drops calls constantly and consistently has lower bars of service than any other phone I have had. I actually  brought out and older phone for use in my home as this phone has NO SIGNAL. I am VERY disappointed.

Reviews.Title: My Smart Phone
Reviews.Author: L. Eldridge
Reviews.Content: I used to say that I didn't want a phone that would be smarter than me but now I know what I have been missing!! I absolutely love my new phone!!

Reviews.Title: I am excited!
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth Watson
Reviews.Content: I wanted this phone the first time I read about it.  I bought a used one at Amazon, a few snafu's that were resolved quickly!  It is awesome!  It is totally what I hoped it would be.  I don't understand why Best Buy stopped selling it for Boost Mobile, hmmm.

Reviews.Title: Love this phone
Reviews.Author: M. Carter "Just starting out"
Reviews.Content: I purchased the phone for a family member. He chose this phone but the product rating was very positive rating. He loves the phone it was no problem at all transferring his phone # on the phone. He stated that the packaging was very secure and the product came in excellent condition with no problem. I actually looked at the phone myself and it was so advanced that I am truly interested in purchasing one myself. The product itself looks to be well worth it.

Reviews.Title: Exceeds  Walmart  T Mobile LG9
Reviews.Author: Scott S. Divincenzo "scottidee"
Reviews.Content: The ZTE "Force" N9100 Exceeds  its  T-Mobile LG9 Comp &  for the $ range although  $200 could have included another 1gb of RAM.Nevertheless, I've settled on 4G spree for now.  App Mover & Task Manager are recommended.

Reviews.Title: OK phone but probably worth it to spend a little more when the next model or two above this has a deal
Reviews.Author: E.G.
Reviews.Content: The processor power and storage are fine...no problems there. Battery life not bad either. Camera ok at best. takes clear pics at regular settings but the zoom on this is a waste as pictures are terrible. Same for front facing camera. I was lured into this phone because it had 4g. It was cheaper then some other models that only had 3g at the time. The speaker sounds tinny with some pops and hiss at max volume. Otherwise speaker works for conversation and watching stuff from crackle, listening to Pandora, Youtube, etc. The download speed isnt bad when using 4g or wi-fi. The main problem with this phone is the microphone. People are constantly having trouble hearing me and I have a pretty loud voice and I speak clearly. I have to repeat myself constantly and find myself getting the most frustrated over this issue. If you plan to use this phone nearly exclusively with a bluetooth headset or car link/home link and you can find this phone cheap then I think you'll be happy. Otherwise save up and buy the next 4g model up like the newer kyocera hydro or the 2nd edition of the Samsung Prevail.

Reviews.Title: Excellent 4G phone, with an affordable price.
Reviews.Author: Darryl T Charles
Reviews.Content: It upgraded to 4G with great reception,.I can barely notice any scratches on the phone. I was also impressed with the talk time.

Reviews.Title: I like this phone
Reviews.Author: Brighteyes "Dave"
Reviews.Content: I've been using this phone for months with Boost Mobile.  I used to use Sprint and bought their latest phones.  I find no reduction in service, the data streams are good, the price of the phone and Boost is good.

Reviews.Title: i returned this product.
Reviews.Author: mario
Reviews.Content: this phone and their tech support was bad. they couldn't transfer my data from my previous phone to this phone. that was just 1 problem. the other problem was when the phone rang and you wasn't around to answer it never showed a call came thru. it also did this to text messages you have to search and find out that you got a call or text. most phones show that you missed a call or text so you can get back to that person, but this phone don't show that. it's 4g, but I returned this phone and stuck with a 3g phone that saves me the trouble.

Reviews.Title: good phone
Reviews.Author: Max Allred
Reviews.Content: I like the phone it works good I can here every one that calls me oh and it runs apps good and take good pic!

Reviews.Title: Great Basic 4G Smartphone
Reviews.Author: Rome
Reviews.Content: If you want a simple 4G smartphone, this is the way to go.  I mostly use my phone to make phone calls, text, and listen to Pandora.  On some occasions I use Google Maps and its GPS directions to help get me to where I need to go.  This phone can multitask such as stream music through Pandora, provide GPS navigation, and allow texting.  Long story short, the phone handles simple tasks very well and can do a little bit more.  However, occasionally it will randomly shut down, drop calls, and be a little sluggish.  So if you need things to move at the blink of an eye, this is not the phone for you.  It has a decent about of space for downloading apps and storing music.  All around good (not great) phone.  It gets the job done.

Reviews.Title: zte force a really good phone
Reviews.Author: walter tooke
Reviews.Content: so far so good its working fine and its alot biger screen then the old  phone and has alot more memory space .and amazon got it to me quick and had no hasslles

Reviews.Title: phone
Reviews.Author: S. Cole
Reviews.Content: key board a bit small but overall works well good sound and size is good too. apps are easy to get

Reviews.Title: Phone Nice but unable to activate for 2 MONTHS!!!!
Reviews.Author: Alexander Love
Reviews.Content: I received this phone and it was in good condition like the description. What they didnt tell me was that these phones are still activated under the previous owner. I spent ALL day trying to activate this phone with no luck. Then took it to a Boost Mobile store. They looked at me like I stole the phone because the previous owner is still registered and has a pin number which makes me unable to use this phone until two months from today when his file expires. What good is this phone if I cant use it for two months?Watch what you buy online!!! Most of these dealers are scams looking for a quick buck. Next time I will just pay full price and go to the store.

Reviews.Title: Very good value for the price.
Reviews.Author: FrankHerrera
Reviews.Content: Of course it is no Samsung Galaxy III or an I Phone 5, but it does work very well and the 4G feature really helps. Very good value for the price.

Reviews.Title: love it!!!!
Reviews.Author: amanda keys
Reviews.Content: I love this phone came in quick I even bought one for my boyfriend he loves his too I will be buying some accesseries for our phones at some point

Reviews.Title: Great battery life
Reviews.Author: joe
Reviews.Content: Much better than HTC Evo Design, but it has some issues with email accounts!!!  Battery seems to last me about 2 days.

Reviews.Title: pretty weak performance in outlying areas....works well in the city
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Phone and cell service was not what expected. I looked pretty carefully at the service map for Boost but either the phone wasn't strong enough to pull in the signal or the signal was pretty weak...pay attention to your service areas...

Reviews.Title: Great phone
Reviews.Author: Kurtglo "K. Michael"
Reviews.Content: 4G is awesome- much faster; especially for tethering. Great job Boost Mobile! So far no problems...I've been using the phone for about 4 months now. Would buy again.

Reviews.Title: By Force......!
Reviews.Author: D. M. Switzer
Reviews.Content: I've had many,many cellphones but bar none this is the PHONE!! First off,this is a 4G phone :-) which is lightening quick.Secondly,this cellphone has a much bigger screen to view MY e-mails/IM & in general.Thirdly,this cellphone has a lotta app's for which YOU can explore on your own time & a setting for NO pop-up.Next,it's affordable for everyone because Boost has a SHRINKAGE program when you activate your new cellphone :-)!Give this cellphone a chance and I'll bet you'll discover it's a bargain if ur living on a Budget plus,so much better than a iPhone happens to be.Bet you won't go wrong for the money$$$$ you invest,time importing ur info to the Boost Co and you can personalize your cellphone in ways ya couldn't do with any iPhone by upgrading your mb(Mega-Bits,this storages ALL ur info).Take that iPhone!Don't take My word for it try it for yourself.-Ms.D.M. Switzer p.s.The only thing holding this phone from 100% Perfection is it's not Waterproof but they may make a version of it in the future.There's Hydro Edge cellphone,which is a BIGGER & better version of the original.Boost Hydro is the original WATERproof cellphone from Kyocera,this Co originated cellphones.What a great combination durability,technology and waterproof= Excellence!!

Reviews.Title: Love the ZTE Phones
Reviews.Author: Daniel Berry Jr.
Reviews.Content: First I must say this is the second ZTE phone I have bought and I love the way ZTE makes their phones. The first one I bought was the ZTE Warp Sequent and it was a great phone the best I have ever owned. I had my Sequent for two years and it only died because I accidentally dropped it in a parking lot. I bought this phone because the previous ZTE was so great and I am sure this one will be great too. I went from a Samsung Galaxy SII to this phone because the ZTE is way way better. Every Samsung phone I have owned has been a big mistake purchasing it and I am so glad their is another company to choose from now. My Galaxy SII crashed all the time, was very slow, and had a horrible screen response when using it. It was so frustrating it was not worth 5 dollars in my opinion. That is the last Samsung I will ever own. I have owned about 8 or 9 Samsung phones and they are great for the first week after you buy them and then they all the sudden get slow, the screen does not respond right, and they just cause a major headache. The ZTE does not give me 1/4 the hassle I have had from the Samsung phones. The only thing that I will say about the ZTE Force is when listening to music they could have put just a little bit louder amplifier in it; however, I will not complain because I probably should not be listening to music that loud anywhere. ZTE you have a life long customer with me. Love the phones and no headache.

Reviews.Title: Problems with ZTE phone and Zero Tech Support
Reviews.Author: John Ware
Reviews.Content: I was very excited to get the ZTE Force, but that quickly went away.  The phone's browser would not allow more than one letter to be typed in so that I could only search on "g" verses Green Lantern for example.  Sending text is very slow for some reason.  Another problem is that the phone only shows up on my Mac laptop as a software install disk.  So it cannot be backedup and sync'd.  ZTE tech support is less than abysmal!  I went thru 3 "techs" all of whom knew nothing, and one of whom said she could not help me because I COULD NOT TELL HER THE PROBLEM!  Unbelievable.  I told her over and over.  The phone does not show up on my Mac.  Yes, I did install the Mac Software several times.  Boost tech support was slightly more helpful once I was able to wade thru their labyrinthine voice menu, designed to keep customers far away from a live person.  In the end, I sent the phone back and ordered a Samsung Epic II.  I'm hoping for better tech support from the more massive company.  Hopefully I will not need any tech support.

Reviews.Title: Not-so-smart phone
Reviews.Author: David M.
Reviews.Content: ZTE swings and misses again. I had the original Warp, my sister has the Warp Sequent, and my wife has the Force. I bought them the Sequent and Force based off my positive experience with the Warp (which ended up not so positive later in ownership). The force has great hardware specs, but doesn't act like it. It freezes up quite a bit, is very slow at times, and randomly reboots (so does the Sequent). We will never purchase another ZTE product again.

Reviews.Title: Boosted
Reviews.Author: MB
Reviews.Content: Bought from Boost Mobile web site (one week later on sale for of $150. But,I paid $200). And, some trouble in programming the phone coupled with awful...horrible Web page not working to activate/no beneficial customer support... is a bad product. Had to go to a dealer store to get it activated (and charged $11 activation fee, and, you're right..., their web sight says "Free Activation", and they would not credit me).... I finally got it so I can call, but no hands free. Worse place. Going back to AT&T; after all this and lost money. Yeah, about right!

Reviews.Title: what a POS !!
Reviews.Author: Does it work? I dont know
Reviews.Content: I had this phone for maybe 2 wks the plastic is still on the screen!  Doesn't charge and now it wont even turn on. Perfect no phone at all in the middle of a divorce. Normally my boost phones are great.

Reviews.Title: bought for husband
Reviews.Author: SARAH NANASSY
Reviews.Content: bought this for hubby, he is so picky on phones.  he loves it.  it was cheaper buying here then at store.  it was brand new in box unopened.  no damage to internal package either.  i do not recommend dropping the phone, he already cracked the screen.  So it is not as durable as I had hoped.  but it runs nice, no issues w/ getting activated via Boost either.

Reviews.Title: phone
Reviews.Author: Mo
Reviews.Content: great, however I ordered the phone, expecting to get better service, lte however service no better. changed carriers no will sell phone

ProductInfo.Features: ZTE Force 4G LTE Prepaid Android Phone (Boost Mobile)
ProductInfo.Name: ZTE Force 4G LTE Prepaid Android Phone (Boost Mobile)
